title: Light1992
author: Light1992
content: HiI just want to ask if there are any legit btc mining that i can start mining with as a newbie?

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Try out . Freebitco  They are one of the oldest and are still rewarding users, but the reward is very small. You might need to minne for like a decay before you can get what could be worth something for you. It's completely a waste of time for me, though. All these free mining sites that reward users have all been reduced the moment Bitcoin gained value, and no one is willing to waste some Bitcoin again. If you want to mine some Bitcoin, why not just go into mining fully, get some of the required tools, and set things up? Or better yet, buy and hold some Bitcoin for yourself. There is no more free money anywhere.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: No!https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2415854.0Quote - You CANNOT meaningfully mine bitcoin with your PC or laptop no matter how powerful it is. - You CANNOT meaningfully mine bitcoin with your tablet or phone no matter how powerful it is. - Mining apps for your phone or tablet that claim to mine bitcoin are almost certainly scams. - You CANNOT find software here to mine bitcoin with your PC by itself.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Light1992 on July 15, 2023, 11:30:37 PMHiI just want to ask if there are any legit btc mining that i can start mining with as a newbie?Not a chanceIf you come across any kind of app claiming that you can download and install it to be able to mine Bitcoins, there are very high chances that it's malware or adware.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: No, there is not. Cloud mining services exist and most (if not all) of them are scams. The thing you can do from your phone is to buy bitcoins, manage wallets, and trade bitcoins. You cannot mine bitcoins from any phone.Quote from: Nwada001 on July 15, 2023, 11:34:26 PMTry out . Freebitco  They are one of the oldest and are still rewarding users, but the reward is very small. You might need to minne for like a decay before you can get what could be worth something for you.Freebitco is not a bitcoin mining app.Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on July 15, 2023, 11:46:32 PMIf you come across any kind of app claiming that you can download and install it to be able to mine Bitcoins, there are very high chances that it's malware or adware.100% SCAM.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Op it's just as others have said, free/cloud mining is a complete waste of time and to even make you believe more they'll set up a counter that shows you the amount of Bitcoin you have been able to mine with their service but when it comes to withdrawal you will be asked to pay some certain amount and if you're naive enough to go on with the payment then you'll be kicked out of their system without receiving any coin from them.I would advice that you save up some money and buy little Bitcoin rather than to start scroll through the internet searching for free Bitcoin, if you continue you'll only end up in the dens of scammers.Quote from: Nwada001 on July 15, 2023, 11:34:26 PMTry out . Freebitco  They are one of the oldest and are still rewarding users, but the reward is very small. There's a difference between faucets and cloud mining, freebitco.in offers free BTC to enable users test their gambling system and if you're lucky enough you might be able to multiply it till it gets to the minimum withdrawal amount.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: Quote from: Nwada001 on July 15, 2023, 11:34:26 PMTry out . Freebitco  They are one of the oldest and are still rewarding users, but the reward is very small. You might need to minne for like a decay before you can get what could be worth something for you.its called faucet, tho freebitcoin is really old and now there is no much faucet left    Quote from: Nwada001 on July 15, 2023, 11:34:26 PMIt's completely a waste of time for me, though. All these free mining sites that reward users have all been reduced the moment Bitcoin gained value, and no one is willing to waste some Bitcoin again. If you want to mine some Bitcoin, why not just go into mining fully, get some of the required tools, and set things up? Or better yet, buy and hold some Bitcoin for yourself. There is no more free money anywhere.Yes I do agree with you cloud mining is totally waste of time and waste of money because some of it will end of scam and turned into ponzi schemetho i found cloud mining by binance but i never try it by myself https://pool.binance.com/en/cloud

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: Since you're a newbie and you're looks like trying to earn money in free, you're too late because mining Bitcoin right now required an expensive mining rigs, it's not like decade ago where you get profit by mining Bitcoin using old CPU/GPU using your PC.Try to learn a new skill e.g. UI/UX, design, digital marketing, writer if you want to earn money without any cost.Quote from: dansus021 on July 16, 2023, 02:47:38 AMYes I do agree with you cloud mining is totally waste of time and waste of money because some of it will end of scam and turned into ponzi schemetho i found cloud mining by binance but i never try it by myself https://pool.binance.com/en/cloudIf you think cloud mining is totally waste of time and waste of money, I don't see any reason why you should recommend one of site that offer cloud mining.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: dansus021 on July 16, 2023, 02:47:38 AMtho i found cloud mining by binance but i never try it by myself https://pool.binance.com/en/cloudQuoteMining Duration:180 Days Start from $13.1580(Min. 1TH/s)Est. Mining Duration2023-09-30 ~ 2024-03-27Purchase Every 1 TH/s: Cost 13.1580 USDEst. Output During Mining0.00000227 BTC * 180 DaysSo you pay $ 13 to get back 0.00000227 BTC * 180 which is 0.0004086 BTC in 180 days, valued right now at 12$.You have two scenarios:- the price goes up so the mined bitcoins are worth more, but it makes no sense, you could just buy them now- difficulty drops by a ton so you would get more coins, but that's just as improbable and far more likely it's going to go up, making it even less profitable

comments.author: 20kevin20
comments.body: Anyone who promises you’ll be able to mine Bitcoin for free or anything close to free will scam you. You’re being scammed out of personal information, they’ll collect data from you and sell it, you’ll pay and never see your money again or anything else that’s categorized as scam.Stay away from such offers, please. If it was this simple to mine BTC, BlackRock would be the dumbest investor ever purchasing that many rigs instead of buying used smartphones and using them as miners. Less energy usage, smaller investment, same profit? Doesn’t it sound.. too good to be true?

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Just as others have said, there is no mobile app that you can use to mine Bitcoin. If it were before, as of some years ago, there was this Telegram bot that was paying users some Satoshi just to complete some tasks like watching ads, following social media pages, liking some videos, and commenting on them etc. It was working very fine then but was really time-wasting and a waste of data subscription, but in a month you could still get like $5 worth of Bitcoin, and before then you might have wasted data of about $10, which never balanced with the stress.OP, the only way to earn Bitcoin is to invest in it.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: Quote from: Light1992 on July 15, 2023, 11:30:37 PMHiI just want to ask if there are any legit btc mining that i can start mining with as a newbie?mining apps that claim they can give you profit for free is a scam, mining apps/websites that offer you a "mining package" promising that you a guaranteed profit is a scam. if you want to mine Bitcoin, it would be best for you to actually buy mining rigs. if you are really interested in mining Bitcoin and have questions, there are members here in the forum that might be able to help you answer your questions.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: Quote from: Light1992 on July 15, 2023, 11:30:37 PMHiI just want to ask if there are any legit btc mining that i can start mining with as a newbie?You cannot mine bitcoin any more with your mobile devices, laptops or desktop computers anymore. The days when these were possible are long gone.To have any hope on mining at the time, you need some highly sophisticated gadgets to archive this purpose and the cost on energy to run the process is way too high to operate and maintain.Should you be attempting mining bitcoin by joining any cloud mining site or app, you would as well end up over working your device processor for something that is of no benefit for you.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: There is no app which will mine Bitcoin for you with CPU or GPU. You need ASIC miners to mine Bitcoin. Ethereum cannot be mined aswell due to it being Proof of Stake now after their major update last year.Anyone telling you that you can mine Bitcoin with an app is potentially trying to install virus in your system and may lead to financial loss. If there is any app you are aware of like this, make sure to report it on this forum and aware others.

comments.author: Deva1290
comments.body: Hey brother this is very difficult to find out free mining app but you can try to freebitco which is very old crypto earning free website to spin to roll every hour to get free Bitcoin in worth Satoshi. Everyone can join free to be play free & win alot prizes in lottery.

comments.author: Deva1290
comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on July 16, 2023, 06:07:51 PMThere is no app which will mine Bitcoin for you with CPU or GPU. You need ASIC miners to mine Bitcoin. Ethereum cannot be mined aswell due to it being Proof of Stake now after their major update last year.Anyone telling you that you can mine Bitcoin with an app is potentially trying to install virus in your system and may lead to financial loss. If there is any app you are aware of like this, make sure to report it on this forum and aware others.I fully agree on your statement there is not such a kinda free mining app.  Of mining we have to arrange do big setup have to install to mine with High GPU power. But we can consider to join free legit website such freebitco which really user friendly & hours basis spin to win unlimited prizes

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Do not get fooled by those advertisements and people saying that there's a bitcoin mining app that you can download for you to mine bitcoin. @OP, do not be gullible with such bitcoin mining apps that you ever see and even if someone tells you that there's a legit one, it requires you hardware.Quote from: Nwada001 on July 15, 2023, 11:34:26 PMTry out . Freebitco  They are one of the oldest and are still rewarding users, but the reward is very small. You might need to minne for like a decay before you can get what could be worth something for you.They don't have mining AFAIK but, they have a faucet.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Instead of searching for cloud mining or similar options, I recommend focusing on learning about Bitcoin and its workings if you're a newcomer. It's important to understand that mining Bitcoin requires specialized equipment, and there is no legitimate way to mine it solely using a mobile device or laptop. Beware of websites or individuals claiming otherwise, as they are likely scammers. It's crucial not to trust them or make any deposits to purchase hash rate, as you'll likely be deceived. Instead, dedicate your time to educating yourself about Bitcoin and its mining process.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: tabas on July 16, 2023, 08:10:32 PMThey don't have mining AFAIK but, they have a faucet.Yea, I get to understand that there is a difference between the reward gotten from Freebitco, which is faucet, and that of mining after a few comments and corrections from a few members above. I mistaken it for mining since, when I was using it back then, I could remember some kinds of things that were called mining, but I was totally wrong or misinformed based on the information I got when I was introduced to it.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: Nwada001 on July 16, 2023, 09:24:33 PMQuote from: tabas on July 16, 2023, 08:10:32 PMThey don't have mining AFAIK but, they have a faucet.Yea, I get to understand that there is a difference between the reward gotten from Freebitco, which is faucet, and that of mining after a few comments and corrections from a few members above. I mistaken it for mining since, when I was using it back then, I could remember some kinds of things that were called mining, but I was totally wrong or misinformed based on the information I got when I was introduced to it.I'm guessing you have probably seen their browser mining? see: freebitco.in "Browser Mining" - is it worth it? which has been long defunct as I checked this last year or so. I would also note that they weren't mining bitcoins but probably cpu-mineable coins like XMR. BTC is just too difficult as others mentioned.
